entry.title: Welcome to my blog!
entry.content:
About me and my programming blog:

Hi, I’m Hailey!

I’m a software engineer studying Mathematics and Computing science at Simon Fraser University, Vancouver, BC. I like finding patterns and solving challenging problems. I spend my free time writing codes, debugging them until they work, and hanging out with my nerdy friends.

Below is more about me!

Math & Computer Science


I’m a third year undergraduate student majoring in Mathematics and Computing Science (a.k.a. MACM). MACM is a program for students who came to decide their major between (1) Mathematics and (2) Computing Science, and thought:

“Why give up one? Let’s learn both!”

Yes! I am a programmer with strong mathematical background, or in other direction, a mathematician with strong programming skills. I enjoy applying data structures and algorithms while solving programming problems. You can see my codes here: Competitive Programming with C++.

My university goal is to be able to understand any math / computer related papers and articles I want to read myself. Below are my projects and tools:

My Projects


Special Fortification Unit


Special Fortification Unit (S.F.U.) is a web-based, real-time, multiplayer survival game set at SFU Burnaby. The game was developed in a team of 5 students following the Agile software development process - 6 weeks of developments consisting of 3 iterations.

S.F.U. is my team project for CMPT 276: Intro to Software Engineering.

ColorQuirrel


ColorQuirrel is a MATLAB image processing program that plays around color spaces. It converts the image to several different ways to represent the data, extracts the representative color from the image by clustering the data, and uses down-sampling method to speed up the procedure.

ColorQuirrel is my individual project for CMPT 365: Multimedia Systems.

Sapiens


Sapiens is a human civilization simulator written in Javascript. Humans communicate and interact with each other, each having different abilities and jobs, and the whole system will grow as time goes on......

Sapiens is my individual project, and is still under development.

...and this blog!


My blog is made with Jekyll using Jasper2 Ghost theme. You can find the repository for my blog (before Jekyll build) here.

Some changes made by me:

  • Prism is used for highlighting codes.
  • Posts are sorted in custom priority (Important posts first!)

Favorite Tools


I mainly work with C++ and Node.js. Those two are the languages I am most comfortable with.

I also have used:

  • Express.js, Socket.io for an academic project
  • MySQL with Workbench for an online course
  • MATLAB for a math course and an academic project

I have used, but not yet fluent with:

  • Python3, Selenium, Openpyxl, WordCloud, Matplotlib for an online course
  • PostgreSQL for an academic project
  • Chart.js for a personal project
  • Jekyll, Ruby on Rails, Gulp for this blog

For non-technical tools, I use:

  • XMind for mind maps
  • Calendar+ for time management
  • Trello for kanban task management

Contact


Mail - haa40@sfu.ca | Reply: Within 24 hours
entry.summary: About me and my programming blog: Hi, I’m Hailey!
